reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Increasing access to quality and specialized CP,GBV services in Dana Sub-District.

description.narrative:
*This project is Multi-AOR Project CP/GBV. SoP intending to expand its provision of integrated community-based protection interventions and provision of life-saving protection activities to conflict-affected populations across Northwest Syria. The Project aims to enhance the prevention and mitigation of protection risks, and respond to protection needs providing GBV,CPservices to most vulnerable PiN with a focus on Women, Girls,Boys, and youth(14-24) (including PwDs), prioritizing critical gaps in life-saving protection services, and designed to be people-centered project supports self-sustainable protective environment for the most vulnerable IDPs,in targeted Community and camps. SoP will support existing WGSS and CFS center in Dana Subdistrict (accessible for PwDs) and targeting /4/ surrounding Widow’s Camps (Camps Names and Access permission in the attachments) by establishing static help desk in each camp and targeting the camps by outreach teams as well.
SoP aiming to provide the following activities: GBV: 1-Case Management for the most vulnerable Women and Girls , case fund will be allocated on the budget to support the needs of the most critical cases as per Protection cluster and SCs relevant SOP and guidance. 2-Awareness raising sessions through the mobile team in 4 selected Widow’s camps and Dana Sub-district. 3-Life skills sessions for Women and Girls (inside the static help desks in the camps). 4- Income-generating vocational training for the Women and Girls ( in the nearby WGSS Center). 5-Periodical Safety Audits in the camps by the outreach team. 6-Establish /4/ Women networks, /1/ in each camp. CP: 1-Case Management for Children inside and outside camps ( With a focus on the children who aged out and separated from their care givers in the Widow’s camps ) case fund will be allocated on the budget to support the needs of the most critical cases as per Protection cluster and SCs relevant SOP and guidance (Inter-Agency Guidelines for Case Management amp Child Protection will be applied). 2- Structured PSS sessions for children in camps and the CFS. 3- Awareness raising activities for children, parents, humanitarian workers,community members and camps managment on key child protection concerns, focusing on following topics (Child Labour, FTR, Basic CP, Child Rights) Using UNICEF IEC materials. 4-Center-Based and outreach parenting skills sessions, using IRC Parenting Skills Manual.
By that the static help desks in the camps will be acting as primary portal to Share information and enroll/refer beneficiaries to the available services.
Information/Data will be collected under each activity as per the SoP’s internal reporting mechanism while taking into consideration proper data disaggregation and MoVs, Monthly figures will be shared with Clusters and SCs through 4Ws , Case Management tool and other reporting channels.
Covid-19: SOP is member of Health cluster and receiving frequent updates on the pandemic situation , as for all running projects COVID-19 prevention measures and related recommendations are applied among all activities (center based and outreach).
PwDs Inclusion : SOP note for inclusion of PWDs into the activities attached

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
